reviews.review_msg: Very helpful but disorganized, did not show up for 1 class and did first class as introduction but then he made 2 lectures extra in a last week of finals and rushed the hardest material of rxns. It is hard to understand his accent, questions are not incoureged.

He is amazingly patient and very dedicated to his students. Oftentimes, he would extend his office hours and hold extra review sessions because he genuinely cares about how you are doing in the class. He's always smiling and makes jokes throughout the lectures. SFU should hire him full-time, not just for the summer, SFU needs a professor like him!

Great prof; one of the best I've had. He really cares about how well his students do and it shows in how much time he spends helping them, as well as extending office hours if needed. His notes are really all you need for reading, but you will need the textbook for chapter review questions. All-in-all, one of my favorite profs.

Wow! cant say enough about Dr. Oba. He's an amazing proff, always willing to help and the lectures are vey well prepared. He helps you understand the material and its an awesome intro to Ochem. The midterms are easy  and the final is not too hard. you definately have to study for O chem and put in the effort. dont expect an easy A.
Guys a down prof, just go to class and read over your notes and you'll be fine, he kinda rushed at the end but wasnt even that bad, take o chem with him if u can, hes pretty funny too

Overall I thought he did a good job. The class honestly isnt that hard, like anything put in time and effort and youll do well. I do agree with the difficult marking scheme.. 4 marks for a question but you either get 0, 0.5 for trying , or 4. Also his lack of organization and additional lectures REALLY ticked me off.  In the end a good prof.

Really really hard marker, only gives full marks for the final answer. Doesn't give marks for process and explanation. Notes are pretty organized and an enthusiastic prof. Just really really hard exams and midterms. Exam questions are way harder than the ones in tutorials and textbook.

Honestly the best prof I've ever had. I mean the material's super hard but you can't blame the prof for that. The exams I've heard are more fair than other profs, and if you put in the time, you will get the results. Prof strongly encourages questions and will extend office hours. He's a sessional prof but I seiously think SFU should hire him.

Agree with previous entries that he did not plan lectures well, and now the students suffer because of it. His final is 40% of the stuff he had to rush through, students are relying on textbook to learn complex reactions, which is not what we paid for.

I haven't had his final exam yet, but I thought I'd say that he did not time his lectures properly and had to schedule several additional evening lectures in order to compensate. Also, because of this he had to rush through the last 5 chapters of material in two weeks. Completely ridiculous!

This class is definitely on the more challenging side. Professor Oba is very good at explaining concepts, but prepare to be blindsided during exams. Many questions were based on simpler models from lectures, but VERY challenging. But then again, it's OCHEM. Pretty good overall!
This guy made me love organic chem! I wish he taught at SFU more!
Nicest guy you'll ever meet and he's always willing to help you out with any questions
